addAccountMaxTxValueByRiskScore(address,.details: Function add an Account Max Transaction Value By Risk Score ruleFunction has ruleAdministratorOnly Modifier and takes AppManager Address Param

params._maxValue: array of max-tx-size allowed within period (whole USD max values --no cents) Each value in the array represents max USD value transacted within _period, and its positions indicate what range of risk scores it applies to. A value of 1000 here means $1000.00 USD.
params._period: amount of hours that each period lasts for. 0 if no period is desired.
params._riskScore: array of risk score ceilings that define each range. Risk scores are inclusive.

returns._0: position of new rule in array

addAccountMaxValueByAccessLevel(address,.details: Function add an Account Max Value By Access Level ruleFunction has RuleAdministratorOnly Modifier and takes AppManager Address Param

params._maxValues: Balance restrictions for each 5 levels from level 0 to 4 in whole USD.

returns._0: position of new rule in array

addAccountMaxValueByRiskScore(address,ui.details: Function to add new AccountMaxValueByRiskScore RulesFunction has ruleAdministratorOnly Modifier and takes AppManager Address Param

params._maxValue: Account Max Value Limit in whole USD for each score range. It corresponds to the _riskScores array and is +1 longer than _riskScores. A value of 1000 in this arrays will be interpreted as $1000.00 USD.

returns._0: position of new rule in array

addAccountMaxValueOutByAccessLevel(addre.details: Function add an Account Max Value Out By Access Level ruleFunction has ruleAdministratorOnly Modifier and takes AppManager Address Param

params._withdrawalAmounts: withdrawal amaount restrictions for each 5 levels from level 0 to 4 in whole USD.

returns._0: position of new rule in array

addAccountMaxTxValueByRiskScore(address,.notice: _maxValue size must be equal to _riskScore. This means that the positioning of the arrays is ascendant in terms of risk scores, and descendant in the size of transactions. (i.e. if highest risk scores is 99, the last balanceLimit will apply to all risk scores of 100.) eg. risk scores      balances         resultant logic -----------      --------         ---------------                                   0-24  =   NO LIMIT     25              500            25-49 =   500    50              250            50-74 =   250    75              100            75-99 =   100

addAccountMaxValueByAccessLevel(address,.notice: The position within the array matters. Position 0 represents access level 0, and position 4 represents level 4.

addAccountMaxValueByRiskScore(address,ui.notice: _maxValue size must be equal to _riskScore. The positioning of the arrays is ascendant in terms of risk score, and descendant in the size of transactions. (i.e. if highest risk score is 99, the last balanceLimit will apply to all risk scores of 100.) eg. risk scores      balances         resultant logic -----------      --------         ---------------                                   0-24  =   NO LIMIT     25              500            25-49 =   500    50              250            50-74 =   250    75              100            75-99 =   100

addAccountMaxValueOutByAccessLevel(addre.notice: The position within the array matters. Position 0 represents access level 0, and position 4 represents level 4.
